verses.textLa: Confitere Domino in bonis tuis, et benedic Deum sæculorum ut reædificet in te tabernaculum suum, et revocet ad te omnes captivos, et gaudeas in omnia sæcula sæculorum.

verses.textEn: You will shine with a splendid light, and all the ends of the earth will adore by you.
verses.textLa: Luce splendida fulgebis: et omnes fines terræ adorabunt te.

verses.textEn: Nations from far away will come to you, bringing gifts. And in you, they shall adore the Lord, and they will hold your land in sanctification.
verses.textLa: Nationes ex longinquo ad te venient: et munera deferentes, adorabunt in te Dominum, et terram tuam in sanctificationem habebunt.

verses.textEn: For they will invoke the Great Name in you.
verses.textLa: Nomen enim magnum invocabunt in te.

verses.textEn: Those who despise you will be cursed, and all those who blaspheme by you will be condemned, and those who build you up will be blessed.
verses.textLa: Maledicti erunt qui contempserint te: et condemnati erunt omnes qui blasphemaverint te: benedictique erunt qui ædificaverint te.

verses.textEn: But you will rejoice in your sons, because they will all be blessed, and they will be gathered together for the Lord.
verses.textLa: Tu autem lætaberis in filiis tuis, quoniam omnes benedicentur, et congregabuntur ad Dominum.

verses.textEn: Blessed are all those who love you and who rejoice in your peace.
verses.textLa: Beati omnes qui diligunt te, et qui gaudent super pace tua.

verses.textEn: Bless the Lord, O my soul, for the Lord our God has freed Jerusalem, his city, from every one of her tribulations.
verses.textLa: Anima mea benedic Dominum, quoniam liberavit Ierusalem civitatem suam a cunctis tribulationibus eius, Dominus Deus noster.

verses.textEn: Happy will I be, if any of my offspring will be left to see the brightness of Jerusalem.
verses.textLa: Beatus ero si fuerint reliquiæ seminis mei ad videndam claritatem Ierusalem.

verses.textEn: The gates of Jerusalem will be built from sapphire and emerald, and all its walls will be surrounded with precious stones.
verses.textLa: Portæ Ierusalem ex sapphiro et smaragdo ædificabuntur: et ex lapide pretioso omnis circuitus murorum eius.

verses.textEn: All its streets will be paved with stones, white and clean. And ‘Alleluia’ will be sung throughout its neighborhoods.
verses.textLa: Ex lapide candido et mundo omnes plateæ eius sternentur: et per vicos eius alleluia cantabitur.

verses.textEn: Blessed be the Lord, who has exalted it, and may he reign over it, forever and ever. Amen.”
verses.textLa: Benedictus Dominus, qui exaltavit eam, et sit regnum eius in sæcula sæculorum super eam. Amen.

verses.textEn: And the sermon of Tobit was completed. And after Tobit received his sight, he lived forty-two years, and he saw the sons of his grandchildren.
verses.textLa: Et consummati sunt sermones Tobiæ. Et postquam illuminatus est Tobias, vixit annis quadraginta duobus, et vidit filios nepotum suorum.

verses.textEn: And so, having completed one hundred and two years, he was buried honorably at Nineveh.
verses.textLa: Completis itaque annis centum duobus, sepultus est honorifice in Ninive.

verses.textEn: For he was fifty-six years old, when he lost the light of his eyes, and he was sixty years old, when he truly received it again.
verses.textLa: Quinquaginta namque et sex annorum lumen oculorum amisit, sexagenarius vero recepit.

verses.textEn: And, in truth, the remainder of his life was in gladness. And so, with the good accomplishment of the fear of God, he departed in peace.
verses.textLa: Reliquum vero vitæ suæ in gaudio fuit, et cum bono profectu timoris Dei perrexit in pace.

verses.textEn: But, in the hour of his death, he called to himself his son Tobias, along with his sons, the seven youths who were his grandsons, and he said to them:
verses.textLa: In hora autem mortis suæ vocavit ad se Tobiam filium suum, et septem iuvenes filios eius nepotes suos, dixitque eis:

verses.textEn: “Nineveh will pass away soon. For the word of the Lord goes forward, and our brothers, who have been dispersed away from the land of Israel, shall return to it.
verses.textLa: Prope erit interitus Ninive: non enim excidit verbum Domini: et fratres nostri, qui dispersi sunt a terra Israel, revertentur ad eam.
verses.notes: The verb ‘excidit’ literally means ‘falls out.’ It is sometimes used to refer to an event that must befall someone, usually an event of destruction or disaster.

verses.textEn: Thus its deserted land will be entirely filled again. And the house of God, which was burned like incense within it, will be rebuilt again. And all those who fear God will return there.
verses.textLa: Omnis autem deserta terra eius replebitur, et domus Dei, quæ in ea incensa est, iterum reædificabitur: ibique revertentur omnes timentes Deum,
verses.notes: The phrasing ‘omnis...replebitur’ means to be entirely filled up again.

verses.textEn: And the Gentiles will relinquish their idols, and they will enter into Jerusalem, and they will dwell in it.
verses.textLa: et relinquent gentes idola sua, et venient in Ierusalem, et inhabitabunt in ea,

verses.textEn: And all the kings of the earth will rejoice in it, adoring the King of Israel.
verses.textLa: et gaudebunt in ea omnes reges terræ, adorantes regem Israel.

verses.textEn: Therefore, my sons, listen to your father. Serve the Lord in truth, and seek to do the things that please him.
verses.textLa: Audite ergo filii mei patrem vestrum: Servite Domino in veritate, et inquirite ut faciatis quæ placita sunt illi:

verses.textEn: And command your sons, so that they may accomplish justice and almsgiving, and so that they may be mindful of God and may bless him at all times, in truth and with all their strength.
verses.textLa: et filiis vestris mandate ut faciant iustitias et eleemosynas, ut sint memores Dei, et benedicant eum in omni tempore in veritate, et in tota virtute sua.

verses.textEn: And now, sons, listen to me, and do not remain here. But, on whatever day you will bury your mother near me in one sepulcher, from that time, direct your steps to leave this place.
verses.textLa: Nunc ergo filii audite me, et nolite manere hic: sed quacumque die sepelieritis matrem vestram circa me in uno sepulchro, ex eo dirigite gressus vestros ut exeatis hinc:

verses.textEn: For I see that its iniquity will bring about its end.”
verses.textLa: video enim quia iniquitas eius finem dabit ei.

verses.textEn: And it happened that, after the death of his mother, Tobias withdrew from Nineveh, with his wife, and sons, and sons of sons, and he was returned to his father-in-law.
verses.textLa: Factum est autem post obitum matris suæ, Tobias abscessit ex Ninive cum uxore sua, et filiis, et filiorum filiis, et reversus est ad soceros suos.

verses.textEn: And he found them unharmed in a good old age. And he took care of them, and he closed their eyes. And all the inheritance of the house of Raguel passed to him. And he saw the sons of his sons to the fifth generation.
verses.textLa: invenitque eos incolumes in senectute bona: et curam eorum gessit, et ipse clausit oculos eorum: et omnem hereditatem domus Raguelis ipse percepit: viditque quintam generationem, filios filiorum suorum.

verses.textEn: And, having completed ninety-nine years in the fear of the Lord, with joy, they buried him.
verses.textLa: Et completis annis nonaginta novem in timore Domini, cum gaudio sepelierunt eum.

verses.textEn: But all his family and all his lineage continued with a good life and in holy conversation, so that they were acceptable both to God and to men, as well as to everyone who dwelt in the land.
verses.textLa: Omnis autem cognatio eius, et omnis generatio eius in bona vita, et in sancta conversatione permansit, ita ut accepti essent tam Deo, quam hominibus, et cunctis habitantibus in terra.
verses.notes: Notice that the word ‘generatio’ is used to refer to lineage, rather than to the members of one time period (generation). Similarly, when Christ said that ‘this generation’ would not pass away until all was accomplished, he meant ‘this lineage,’ in other words, the human race. He was not saying that the people of that time period would see everything accomplished in their lifetime.
